title: Casualties unknown in Hebei residential explosion
text:
By ZHANG YU in Shijiazhuang | chinadaily.com.cn | Updated: 2019-10-24 11:36

An explosion rocked a residential building in Handan city, North China’s Hebei province on Thursday morning, as reported by local news outlet Yanzhao Evening News.

The cause of the blast and total casualties are still unknown at press time.

According to the report, a loud explosive sound was heard around 8 am in the No 14 building of the Ladefangsi residential community, after which the whole building shook and windows shattered.

Black smoke came from the fifth floor of the building, a resident living at another building in the community was quoted as saying.

Photos from the scene posted online showed the building has six or seven floors and some windows of the building were broken. Bedsheet-like objects were hanging from the window frames of the fifth floor.

Fire trucks and ambulances were at the scene for rescue work, the report said.
